intro: Faroa schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
